current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
Honoring the life, accomplishments, and legacy of Louis Zamperini and expressing condolences on his
			 passing.

cosponsor.#tail: ) submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the

action-desc.#text: Committee discharged; considered, amended, and agreed to

text.#text: honors the life, accomplishments, and legacy of Louis Zamperini;
extends heartfelt sympathies and condolences to the family of Louis Zamperini; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to identify an appropriate and lasting program of the United States
			 Government to honor the legacy of Louis Zamperini.

quote.#tail:
Zamperini was born on January 26, 1917, to Anthony and Louise Zamperini,
			 in Olean, New York;

text.#text:
Whereas Louis Zamperini represented the United States in the 1936 Olympics in Berlin as a distance
			 runner;

Whereas upon the conclusion of World War II, Louis Zamperini was released from the prisoner of war
			 camp in September 1945;
Whereas Louis Zamperini was given the honor of carrying the Olympic flame in 1984, 1996, and 1998;

Whereas in the years after World War II, Louis Zamperini traveled as an inspirational public
			 speaker, using his experiences to inspire a message of forgiveness;

quote.#tail: in honor of Louis Zamperini; and

text.#text: Whereas the airport in Torrance, California, was named

Whereas Louis Zamperini leaves a legacy as a national hero and an inspiration to future
			 generations: Now, therefore, be it

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 SRES 531 ATS: Honoring the life, accomplishments, and legacy of Louis Zamperini and expressing condolences on his passing.
